text.__SUMMARY__: Vipera ammodytes gregorwallneri is a venomous viper subspecies  endemic to Austria and the former Yugoslavia.It has no common English name.
text.Geographic range: It is found in Austria and the former Yugoslavia.
text.See also:
List of viperine species and subspecies
Viperinae by common name
Viperinae by taxonomic synonyms
Snakebite
text.Taxonomy: Many authors, such as Golay et al. (1993) do not recognize this taxon and instead relegate it to the synonymy of V. a. ammodytes.
text.Further reading:
Golay P, Smith HM, Broadley DG, Dixon JR, McCarthy CJ, Rage J-C, Schätti B, Toriba M. 1993. Endoglyphs and Other Major Venomous Snakes of the World. A Checklist. Geneva: Azemiops. 478 pp.
Sochurek E. 1974. Vipera ammodytes gregorwallneri n. ssp. Herpet. Blätter, Wien [Vienna] (1).
